description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fvguf","text":"This protocol was used to extract high molecular weight DNA from the sponge (porifera) Halichondria panicea. This protocol contains slight modifications from that presented in Ausubel et al (1995). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":87,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7dns9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvmo8","text":"References: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a15ra","text":"Ausubel, F.; Brent, R.; Kingston, R.; Moore, D.; Seidman, J.G.; Smith, J.;Struhl, K. Short Protocols in Molecular Biology(1995), 3rd ed., Unit 2.1: page 2-3","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":156}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

keywords: DNA extraction, High Molecular Weight DNA, Sponge, Porifera

status.info: We use this protocol and itâs working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"g577","text":"Rinse sample in filter sterilized seawater three times. Use a mortar and pestle to finely grind approximately 1 gram of tissue in liquid nitrogen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fbu63","text":"Add 5 mL of buffer AP1 (QIAGEN, Germany) and mix with 50 ÂµL of 100 mg/mL RNase A. Invert tube a couple of times to mix. Incubate at 65Â°C for 30-60 minutes, inverting the tube approximately every 5-10 minutes (as often as possible). During this step, cells are lysed in presence of SDS. RNase will remove RNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"36gle","text":"Allow the tube to \"cool\" to approximately 50Â°C. Add 150 ÂµL 20 mg/mL Proteinase K. Mix by inverting the tube a couple of times and then incubate at 50Â°C for a minimum of 2 hours. As often as possible, invert the tube to mix. Proteinase K will digest intracellular proteins such as histones and other DNA-binding proteins. It will also digest membrane-bound proteins which will further facilitate cell-lysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ca31k","text":"Cool the sample on ice for 5-10 minutes (depending on the volume) and add 1,700 ÂµL of P3 (QIAGEN, Germany) buffer. Mix gently by inverting the tube 5-10 times. This step will precipitate SDS and polysaccharides (if present).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ap2b1","text":"Spin down the sample in centrifuge at 7,200 RCF for 30 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avo0a","text":"Transfer supernatant with a wide-bore, i.e. cut with sterile blade, P1000/P5000 pipette-tip to a 15 mL tube. Subsequently, add Chloroform:Phenol:Isoamyl in a 1:1 mixture by volume. For initial protocol evaluation, vortex the sample until emulsions have formed. Prolonged incubation is encouraged. If downstream DNA yields turn out high, revert to a non-vortexing approach to minimize DNA shearing (gentle, prolonged mixing) Prolonged incubation is encouraged/essential.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8f6pv","text":"Spin down the sample at 7,200 RCF for 20 minutes and remove the DNA-containing supernatant (slowly and wide a wide-bore tip).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d7moq","text":"Repeat step 7-8 one to two times and subsequently transfer the supernatant to a clean 15 mL tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"43uks","text":"Add Molecular biology grade 3M sodium-acetate pH 5.2Â±0.1 (S7899 Sigma) to a final concentration of 0.3 M. This step will lower pH and neutralize the phosphodiester backbone, thus rendering the DNA ready for precipitation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"acktu","text":"Add 1 volume of room-temperature isopropanol if HMW DNA is the intended target or use 1 volume of ice-cold isopropanol if both LMW and HMW is the target (with the option of including an over-night incubation at -20Â°C). For HMW DNA, invert tube a few times to mix until DNA precipitates as nice jelly-fish threads (within a few min). Then centrifuge for 10 min at 7,200 RCF (at room-temperature if HMW DNA is the target).The short incubation with isopropanol will preferentially precipitate HMW DNA species and by keeping the sample at room-temperature, salt carry-over is further minimized.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"29nd7","text":"Remove the supernatant and add as much ice-cold 70 % ethanol as possible and gently invert tube to mix. Gently dislodge (if possible) the pellet.  Centrifuge for 10 min at 7,200 RCF and replace as much liquid with fresh ice-cold 70 % ethanol. Spin again and remove as much liquid as possible. Finally aspirate residual ethanol with a P10 pipette (after a short spin).This will remove salts and replace isopropanol with the more volatile ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1fglv","text":"Air-dry the pellet for 5-10 minutes. Do not over-dry!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6i467","text":"Add 100-200 ÂµL AE buffer. Incubate the sample at room-temperature or fridge for a minimum of two days. Longer incubations are encouraged (1-2 weeks if time allows and no DNase activity is assumed present). If the pellet is not readily dissolving, then try to pull out \"DNA threads\" with a P10 pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"430al","text":"Measure quality and concentration with NanoDrop (or similar) and dsDNA (Qubit) and evaluate DNA size-distribution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bfvnr","text":"If A260/A230 is \u003c 2.0, perform a clean-up step with the Qiagen PowerPro CleanUp kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8bfpv","text":"Measure quality and concentration with NanoDrop (or similar) and dsDNA (Qubit) and evaluate DNA size-distribution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
